availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathan Castle (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Killed 1857.)

body.p: Floyd County, Kentucky, and Johnson County, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Sarah Castle. Father of Nancy Castle, James Castle, Elizabeth Castle, Judea Castle, and Jacob Castle. Resident of Floyd County in 1830. Farmer in Floyd County in 1840. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Killed by Johnathan Ward in Johnson County in January 1857.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, Paintsville, p. 99.
